poem:
Title: "A Tale of Endangered Ink and Dreams"

Leafless maple arms, stretch to the icy sun,
Within their frostbitten grasp, a mystery spun.
Vanished whispers of heart-pounding games,
In stowed away portrait, Gretzky by name.
A Canadian treasure, omnipresent myth,
In million-dollar echo, bids fervor forthwith.
Buried deep in the north, an unknowing vault,
Sports card 'holy grail', in paper and salt.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Ultra-rare Wayne Gretzky rookie cards expected to be part of $3.72m Canadian auction Among avid collectors of sports trading cards, rumours of a “holy grail” – a trove of cards so rare that they shouldn’t exist – have long swirled, but never materialized. “It thought if we were ever going to find it … it would be buried deep up in Canada and the owners wouldn’t even know they had it,” said the expert Steve". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
